definition: to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: You have soured the naturally excellent disposition of ghosts and goblins.
sentences.chinese: 你们丑化了鬼魂和精灵的善良本性。
希望会丑化丑恶的东西。

sentences.english: He says accusations of racism are smears that he has come to expect.
sentences.chinese: 他认为指控他为种族主义者是对他的意图进行丑化。
爱情是一个巨大的丑化家。

sentences.english: However, if misconducted, it will have the effect of vilifying .
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果搭配不当，就会产生丑化的效果。

sentences.english: "The radical right and the Congressional Republicans have demonized me, " he answered.
sentences.chinese: “激进的右派和国会共和党人把我丑化了，”他答道。

sentences.english: Truth does not exist in the uglified reality.
sentences.chinese: 真理不存在于丑化了的现实里。

sentences.english: Fifth, we must continue to create news and vilifying their leadership.
sentences.chinese: 第五，我们必须继续创造新闻和丑化他们的领导。

sentences.english: Some Americans are making every effort to uglify China.
sentences.chinese: 一些美国人总在设法丑化中国。

sentences.english: Fifth , make news continuously to uglify their leaders .
sentences.chinese: 第五，要不断制造新闻，丑化他们的领导人。

sentences.english: China, a peace-loving people, but you have to vilify the aggressor?
sentences.chinese: 中国，一个爱好和平的民族，却被你们丑化为侵略者？

sentences.english: Jesus knows that at times we are tempted to demonize our enemies.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣知道，我们有时很想丑化我们的敌人。

definition: to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
